fields.description:
h3. Summary

When creating a new space, the user add the description. Once save, the description become empty.

h3. Steps to replicate
# Click create space
# Choose documentation space
# Add all the details - Spacename, spacekey and description
# Save the space


h3. Observed behaviour
 !detail.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Expected behaviour

The description added when we create the space should be there.


h3. Workaround

User may add the description from the Edit Space Details tab.
fields.summary: Space description is empty

fields.description:
Stack trace
        java.util.concurrent.TimeoutException
	at com.netflix.hystrix.AbstractCommand.handleTimeoutViaFallback(AbstractCommand.java:997)
	at com.netflix.hystrix.AbstractCommand.access$500(AbstractCommand.java:60)
	at com.netflix.hystrix.AbstractCommand$12.call(AbstractCommand.java:609)
	at com.netflix.hystrix.AbstractCommand$12.call(AbstractCommand.java:601)
	at rx.internal.operators.OperatorOnErrorResumeNextViaFunction$4.onError(OperatorOnErrorResumeNextViaFunction.java:140)
	at rx.internal.operators.OnSubscribeDoOnEach$DoOnEachSubscriber.onError(OnSubscribeDoOnEach.java:87)
	at rx.internal.operators.OnSubscribeDoOnEach$DoOnEachSubscriber.onError(OnSubscribeDoOnEach.java:87)
	at com.netflix.hystrix.AbstractCommand$HystrixObservableTimeoutOperator$1.run(AbstractCommand.java:1142)
	at com.netflix.hystrix.strategy.concurrency.HystrixContextRunnable$1.call(HystrixContextRunnable.java:41)
	at com.netflix.hystrix.strategy.concurrency.HystrixContextRunnable$1.call(HystrixContextRunnable.java:37)
	at com.atlassian.workcontext.api.WorkContextFunctionWrapper.lambda$withContext$2(WorkContextFunctionWrapper.java:65)
	at com.atlassian.workcontext.api.WorkContextFunctionWrapper.lambda$withContext$7(WorkContextFunctionWrapper.java:117)
	at com.atlassian.workcontext.api.WorkContextFunctionWrapper.lambda$withContext$3(WorkContextFunctionWrapper.java:74)
	at com.netflix.hystrix.strategy.concurrency.HystrixContextRunnable.run(HystrixContextRunnable.java:57)
	at com.netflix.hystrix.AbstractCommand$HystrixObservableTimeoutOperator$2.tick(AbstractCommand.java:1159)
	at com.netflix.hystrix.util.HystrixTimer$1.run(HystrixTimer.java:99)
	at java.util.concurrent.Executors$RunnableAdapter.call(Executors.java:511)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.runAndReset(FutureTask.java:308)
	at java.util.concurrent.ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor$ScheduledFutureTask.access$301(ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor.java:180)
	at java.util.concurrent.ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor$ScheduledFutureTask.run(ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor.java:294)

	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:624)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:748)

Might be real timeout to Media or just Hystrix has problem

See https://hello.atlassian.net/browse/MPDEV-639 for more detail.

Use "eventtype="micros_confluence-prod-us-6" "3b1f5903-5499-4caa-abc1-d1f1ab0a0829" cd960b75-51d3-44ac-9936-796cf10b1863 level=ERROR" Splunk query for an example
fields.summary: Confluence sometimes failed to download manifest file (generated by Zipper) from Media due to timeoutexception

fields.description:
Currently an URL within Confluence Question wasn't user-friendly as the URL was too long and contains a lot special characters which make it difficult to understand the content based on the URL for instance:

{code}https://cheeyoung.atlassian.net/wiki/display/KBLOOD/customcontent/list/ac%3Acom.atlassian.confluence.plugins.confluence-questions%3Aquestion?ac.com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.confluence-questions.path=/questions/250019861{code}

Possible workaround 
There is a share function in  CQ to share the URL 
 !image-2018-09-05-22-26-36-818.png|thumbnail! 

However most of the user share URL directly from the browser but not within Confluence
fields.summary: User Friendly URL for Confluence Question

fields.description: It would be useful if slack notification is enabled for the Confluence Question as well so that user could get a slack notification on the Confluence Question as well.
fields.summary: Slack notification for Confluence Questions

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When navigating to Confluence RSS tab, 400 error directed when clicking on the link to subscribe for the feed.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to any RSS tab from the space tools.
**  !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
# Confluence directed us to a 400 error page.
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Expected Results
Subscribe to the feed.

h3. Actual Results
Page with 400 error is shown


h3.Workaround
No workaround at the moment.
fields.summary: RSS feeds directed to error 400

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When using a Trello board macro in a page that will also contain a roadmap macro, the Trello board will be displayed as a blank session after publishing the page.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new page in Confluence
# Add a Trello Board with an URL from an existing board (in the edit mode, click on *Insert* > *Other Macros* > *Trello Board*
# Add a roadmap macro or Jira issues Calendar macro on the same page
# Publish the page


h3. Expected Results
The Trello board should be rendered properly.

h3. Actual Results
Instead of having the board content being displayed, the page will only contain a blank space where the board should be.
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

 There is a few errors generated at the browser console as:
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround
No workaround at the moment would be removing the roadmap macro so that the trello board is rendered on the page again.
fields.summary: Trello board not rendering properly if the page includes Roadmap or Jira issue Calendar macros

fields.description:
h3. Summary

White space appears before excerpt Include macro when Remove Surrounding Panel is enable/tick


*Steps to replicate*

# Create a test page, and add excerpt macro
# Then add note macro inside the excerpt macro
# Create a new test page and add a text *For testing purpose*
# Under the text, add excerpt include macro
#* Page Containing the Excerpt * must be the page name you created in step 1
#* Tick Surrounding Panel 
# Save the page


h3. Observed Behaviour

!1.png|thumbnail!


h3. Expected Behaviour

Should not have any white space between the text and excerpt include macro
fields.summary: White space appears before excerpt include macro

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The resize Space Logo / Avatar functionality breaks when attempting to upload an image for the second time . Video showing this behaviour:  [^2018-09-04_16-38-42.mp4] 


h3. Customer Impact
All Confluence Cloud Customers

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go into Space Settings > Overview > Space details
# Click Edit to edit the Space Logo and then click Cancel
# Click on the Edit again and Click "Restore defaults"

h3. Expected Results
Resize functionality to work
 !2018-09-04_16-41-52.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
Resize functionality doesn't work
 !2018-09-04_16-42-07.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround
* Refresh the page and the resize will function correctly.
fields.summary: Unable to resize space logo / space avatar

fields.description:
CONFCLOUD-1212

CONFCLOUD-999999

CONFSERVER-121
fields.summary: TEST BUG

fields.description:
There is so much wasted spacing (icon padding, spacing between items, etc) in the sidebar, which we can make use of to display more nested items.
I can only see a maximum of 3 levels of items using a 15 inch macbook with the default sidebar width.



*Reporter*: Hanh Pho
*E-mail*: [mailto:hphoquan@atlassian.com]
fields.summary: Too much spacing wasted into the icons in the sidebar

fields.description: Currently in Confluence, customization on the status macro wasn't not allowed due to [Functional differences in Confluence Cloud|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/restricted-functions-in-confluence-cloud-734070955.html]. It would be useful if the ability to adjust lozenge width and font size is allow for customer to make the status readable when the character exceed the width.
fields.summary: Ability to adjust Status lozenge width and font size

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Unable to publish a blog page (with error below) when drag and drop two or more images into the same table cell.

!Error publishing.png|thumbnail!
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a blog
 # Add a title
 # Add a table in the page content
 # Click on one of the table cells
 # Highlight two images from windows explorer
 # Drag and drop those images to one of the table cells
 # Click on publish

h3. Expected Results

Should be able to publish
h3. Actual Results

Unable to publish the page with the images
h3. Notes

Posted a video that shows the error and the workaround to fix the issue.
h3. Workaround

Notice that upon dragging and dropping the images into the table cell, there is one other empty attachment being added.
Remove this "empty attachment" and click on publish
fields.summary: Unable to publish blog page if images gets drag and drop in the same table cell

fields.description:
This is a response I get from my cloud development instance:

{code}
"_links": {
        "editui": "/pages/resumedraft.action?draftId=284432669&draftShareId=7aedc618-3502-47a8-97a8-7724afa7815a",
        "webui": "/pages/resumedraft.action?draftId=284432669&draftShareId=7aedc618-3502-47a8-97a8-7724afa7815a",
        "context": "/wiki",
        "self": "https://hello.atlassian.net/wiki/rest/api/content/284432669?status=draft",
        "tinyui": "/x/HRn0E",
        "collection": "/rest/api/content",
        "base": "https://hello.atlassian.net/wiki"
    }
{code}

Those {{editui}} and {{webui}} simply don't work when you navigate to them. To reproduce this issue:

# Hit the "Create content" rest API with some storage format content.
# Try and navigate to the editui in the response from that request.
fields.summary: REST API - Create content: The 'editui' link in the root '_links' object in the response is a link that points to a 404.

fields.description:
When a url contains a link to a Heading or anchor Chrome, if the URL to that Heading is pasted directly into the address bar of Google Chrome, or if link is opened in a new Tab user is not taken directly to that heading. Only reproducible in Chrome. Mozilla Firefox and MS IE does not reproduce the behavior.

h3. Steps to reproduce:
# Copy the link text directly (NOt by clicking on 'copy link text in the browser')
# Paste the link in the address bar and hit Enter
*OR*
# Right-click on the link and choose 'Open in a new TAB'

h3. Expected behavior:
User should be taken directly to that particular heading.

h3. Actual behavior:
User is taken to the top of the page where the Heading is.

h3. workaround:
* Right-click on the intended link to heading and choose 'Copy Link Address', or
* Use Mozilla Firefox (sometimes that didn't work either, intermittent!)
fields.summary: Links to Anchors Does Not Go to Intended Heading or Anchor in Chrome Browser if URL is directly pasted in Address Bar or link opened in a new Tab
Atlassian Summit and AtlasCamp

fields.description:
h3. The Issue
If you add a Header 1 into a section while utilizing Windows OS, you end up with scroll bars where the sections are located at. 

h3. Steps to replicate
# Create a new page
# Add two sections
# Insert a text in Header 1
# Publish the page

h3. Expected Results
The page would be displayed and the content would be rendered according to its size

h3. Actual Results
 !windows-scrollbars.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Additional Info
When using IE, the sections does not display a vertical scrollbar, but instead, code blocks displays a horizontal scrollbar
fields.summary: Windows OS displays scroll bar when using sections

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Software project space menu items are not display in german language when confluence language is set to german.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set Confluence and Jira language to German.
# Create a project in Jira
# Create a Software project space and link it to the Project created in jira

h3. Expected Results
Menu text is fully in German


h3. Actual Results
Menu items are in English
 !Ger.png|thumbnail! 


h3.Workaround
None
fields.summary: Untranslated menu when confluence language set to German

fields.description:
Currently, if double-hyphens are typed into Confluence editor, they are turned into a long horizontal line (two characters length). It's frustrating for some users if they don't want this auto conversion and want double-hyphens in the text.
h3. Workaround

Use either *code block* or *noformat* macro to enclose text like code or anything they want to appear same as they write it. !Screen Shot 2018-08-31 at 12.08.25 PM.png!
fields.summary: Allow customization of Markdown behavior

fields.description:
h3.The Scenario
Imagine you have a group of customers who use your instance, and none of them are allowed to see the content from another company. Thus, you manage to restrict the spaces for each individual group, and now wishes to set up the Site Homepages (whenever someones access the instance), and redirect those users to the space from the group they belong to

h3. Current Scenario
You can't, Site Homepage is configured for all Confluence users

h3. Expected Scenario
You would be able to configure the homepage for each group individually
fields.summary: Allow users to change Site Homepage based on groups
Routes webpack plugin generates arrow function which breaks IE11

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Cannot Edit Meeting Notes that contain Jira Macros

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# On a Confluence Cloud site, create a new pages using the *Meeting Notes* template.
# Add a *Jira Macro* to it
# *Publish* the Page
# Once published, click *Edit*

h3. Expected Results

You are able to edit the page.

h3. Actual Results

The Editor does not load. Instead an error message saying: "*There was a problem loading the editor*
Our team has been notified. If the problem persists, please contact Atlassian Support."" is displayed.

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Cannot Edit Meeting Notes and Blogposts that contain Jira Macros

fields.description: As an administrator, I would like to be able to generate a list of all spaces in my Confluence Cloud site, having detailed information of who is the creator, when it was last modified, how many pages, attachments, etc.
fields.summary: Generate a Report of Existing Spaces

fields.description:
Since the roll out of [Confluence Editing Improvements|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/confluence-editing-improvements-945107733.html] for blogpost. URL for blog post has been changed from 

Previous blog URL structure example:

<instancename>.atlassian.net/wiki/pages/viewrecentblogposts.action?key=<spacekey>
Current blog URL structure example:

<instancename>.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/<spacekey>/blog/2017/10/11/2850817/<blogtitle>

It would be useful if this feature is bring back to the customer so that they can continue to search for the recent blogpost.

Temporary workaround

{quote}Embded a blog post macro to show recent blog post on a blog as the main page{quote}
fields.summary: Ability to view recent blogpost using viewrecentblogposts.action?key=<spacekey>

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If a page has a colon (\:) on its title, the office (word, excel, powerpoint) macros won't find the documents.

h3. Environment
* Confluence Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page with a colon (\:) on its title (let's say "test : office");
# Attach an office doc;
# Insert the corresponding office macro;
# Try to find the doc in the dropdown;

h3. Expected Results
The document should be listed.

h3. Actual Results
No document is not listed and some errors are logged in the browser:

fields.description:
h3. The Issue
Currently, the error message for specifying an invalid error message in Team Calendars generates a random number which can sometimes be miscomprehended by the users.

h3. Steps to Replicate
# Access a Calendar
# Click *Create Event*
# In the _Date/Time_ fields, input *08:00 AM* until *09:00AM*
# Try creating the event

h3. Current Message
The current message displays something like below:
 !Screen Shot 2018-08-29 at 15.55.09.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Message
Since the hour used in the message is a random one, sometimes, it may be confusing for users that the time format should be in the 24h instead of the 12h.
fields.summary: Change "invalid date-time" error message in Team Calendars

fields.description:
h3. The Issue

Not able to access any page when using Internet Explorer 11
h3. Steps to Replicate
 # Open IE11
 # Access Confluence

h3. Expected Results

Page renders properly
h3. Actual Results

!screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

Use an alternative browser like Chrome, Firefox, or Safari
fields.summary: Internet Explorer 11 is not rendering pages

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition/Current Behavior

After a page has had several images removed from the body content, these removed images (but not deleted from the view attachments page) still show in the preview carousel when previewing other images still present within the body content.
h3. To Reproduce
 # Add attachments to Page and add them to body content.
 # Remove attachment from body content (attachment still listed and present on view attachment page).
 # Click on another attachment within the body content to preview it.
 # When previewing the attachment, click through the left or right options.
 # All attachments are visible within this carousel - including those that have been removed from the body content.

h3. Suggested Behavior

Only attachments used in the body content on a page should be included within the preview carousel.
fields.summary: Remove attachments that are not displayed on the page from the preview carousel

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When using a Trello board macro in a page that will also contain a gadget having issues, the same will avoid the board to be displayed in the page. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new page in Confluence
# Add a Trello Board with an URL from an existing board (in the edit mode, click on *Insert* > *Other Macros* > *Trello Board*
# Make sure to add a gadget that might be facing issues (such as the *Days Remaining in Sprint Gadget*)
# Publish the page


h3. Expected Results
The Trello board should be rendered properly.
h3. Actual Results
Instead of having the board content being displayed, the page will only contain a blank space where the board should be.
!malfunctioning.png|thumbnail! 

!blank.png|thumbnail!
 
h3.Notes
Note that this does happen with the [Roadmap Planner|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/roadmap-planner-macro-724765275.html] macro as well.

h3.Workaround
No workaround at the moment.
fields.summary: Trello Board Rendering Issues with Specific Gadgets

fields.description: It would be useful, if user is allow to display top 10 articles that was being use so that they could aware of the frequently visited page from the service desk agent.
fields.summary: Ability to display top 10/20 visited page from Knowledge  Base

Make /wiki/rest/api/user/watch/content/{contentId} available for apps.

Related articles: https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/rest/#api-user-watch-content-contentId-post

Previously, we can see more than 100 comments in our page, but now, it only displays the first 100/oldest comments


*Steps to replicate:*
 # create a page

*Expected Result*
 All 101 comments should be displayed as previously

!screenshot-2.png|thumbnail!

 *Actual Result*

Only first 100 comments will be displayed

!screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Confluence no longer display more than 100 comments

fields.description:
h3. Summary
User tries to share a page using the share of Team Calendar though nothing happens when clicking the share button.

h3. Environment
* Confluence Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Enter any page.
# Select calendar on the left menu.
# Hit the share button on the upper right.

h3. Expected Results
Prompt a screen to share the page in calendar.

h3. Actual Results
Nothing happens.
 
h3.Workaround
none.
fields.summary: Share button of Team calendars doesn't respond

fields.description:
In Confluence, the user has the ability to embed a Youtube video by simply adding its URL/[Widget Connector|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/widget-connector-macro-724765314.html]. However, if the video has its security to "Private", even though the user's email is allowed to see it according to the video permissions, the same will not be displayed in Confluence for the specific user since it will authenticate through an Atlassian Account. 

This is a feature to allow Confluence to interact with Google's/Youtube security configuration.
fields.summary: Allow Confluence to Interact with Youtube Video's Security

fields.description:
h3. Summary If a page contains a Jira issue macro that does not have an appropriate
' and '

' tag, it will cause a

tag to appear as a translucent grey field that will block access to the page below. h3. Environment Cloud h3. Steps to Reproduce # post a storage format to a page similar to this: {noformat}


INLINE




System JIRAkey,status20key = bar-1 63c80592-58b5-3206-bb77-77839fa25117
 System JIRAkey,status20issuekey in (BAR-2) 63c80592-58b5-3206-bb77-77839fa25117


{noformat} h3. Expected Results The page loads normally. h3. Actual Results Page appears with a translucent grey field that blocks the page. h3. Notes (Optional - If Necessary) h3. Workaround - Type *E* to edit the page and ensure that the jira issue macros have no content surrounding them to the left or right. You may need to delete and re-add them
fields.summary: Jira Issue Macro can cause grey Div in front of content preventing use of the page
Freeze to investigate view page not displaying more than 25 comments
Freeze to investigate view page not displaying more than 25 comments

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Fabric editor shows the redundant page structure in the breadcrumb.

By default, the first 3 pages will be redirected to the Overview (they will be redirected to Home page if it's configured):
 # *Sample Project* [https://example.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/SP]
 # *Pages* [https://example.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/SP/pages]
 # *Sample Project* [https://example.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/SP/overview]
 # Hello World [https://ky20180320.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/SP/pages/23822337/Hello+World]
 # Child [https://example.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/SP/pages/220561409/Child]
 # Grand-child [https://example.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/SP/pages/220528641/Grand-child]

 
!Screenshot 2018-08-28 14.01.26.png|thumbnail!!Screenshot 2018-08-28 14.01.38.png|thumbnail!!Screenshot 2018-08-28 14.01.57.png|thumbnail!


h3. Suggested Solution 

To make the current breadcrumb less redundant, let the editor only shows the Overview in the root:
 # *Sample Project* [https://example.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/SP/overview]
 # Hello World [https://ky20180320.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/SP/pages/23822337/Hello+World]
 # Child [https://example.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/SP/pages/220561409/Child]
 # Grand-child [https://example.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/SP/pages/220528641/Grand-child]

h3. Workaround

None.
fields.summary: Remove redundant breadcrumb from the editor

fields.description:
h3. Summary
[Get group memberships for user|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/rest/#api-user-memberof-get] does not evaluate _start_ query parameter properly. The _start_ value reflects in the response but the result set is the same all the time.
 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Get the user key of a user who is a member of multiple groups. In a dev cloud instance, the _admin_ is by default a member of confluence-users, jira-servicedesk-users, and jira-software-users. 
# Make a request for their groups using the {{/memberof}} endpoint (/wiki/rest/api/user/memberof?key=_admin_). You will get a list of their groups, which in my example is the three mentioned above.
# Add the "start" query string parameter (/wiki/rest/api/user/memberof?start=1&key=<userkey>). 

h3. Expected Results
The result set should start with the value supplied in the _start_ query parameter.

h3. Actual Results 
The _start_ index is always ignored and it returns a list of groups as though the start index was 0.
fields.summary: Get group memberships for user REST API does not reflect the start parameter
temp freeze to get the fix in for UserCard
temp freeze to get the fix in for UserCard

fields.description:
Dear Atlassian,

Document containing following text (with additional screen shoots) is attached to this ticket for better overview.
---
We would like to create ONE Template (OT) to be used in Confluence and Jira. 
The purpose of the OT is to have one dynamic template used for all our information/documents to be constantly updated by our internal staff and external contributors with access to the OT. 

We want the OT to have the same design and functionality as a Wikipedia site with: 

1) Headline Title (To identify document; Labels will be used also for search/filter feature) 
2) Index (Page content macro to have page content headlines as in-page quick links)
3) Sub headlines
4) Text (describe cross references, dynamic words/links etc.) 
5) Images, photos, graphic elements, drawings, mockups etc. 
6) Learning (tutorials etc.) 
7) Links: To other relevant 100% OT,s, websites, videos, articles etc. 

We also want the OT to be created so changed data (deleted, changed or added text) are not saved before an 100% Project Manager (OT-responsible) has approved and/or corrected the changes. 

We are aware about the idea behind Confluence templates and macros, but has ended up with 7+ custom made templates for our documents until now. This will give us unnecessary maintenance issues in the future with changes for the template/s structure.

Our knowledge with Confluence Cloud templates and macros is more than solid (also with restrictions compared to Self-hosted version) and we have been planning/creating our templates by using excerpt and page includes macros to avoid duplicates for easier maintenance. Also with some templates we introduced Page properties for additional informations with custom attributes. In general we love Confluence and the flexibility, but are also searching for more simple solutions to organize our work and document structure.

As organization we are planning a better structure for our workflow and that's how we ended up with this OT approach, especially having next in mind.

First of all we are using Confluence to store all documents from our Development workflow in one space but we also want to have space for Knowledge and Organization (Team members).

With Knowledge space we are going to have our terms defined, articles for learning Confluence usage with our organization or some specific topics, like Wikipedia with a few types of topics/categories. We started creating our definitions (as pages) for various terms we are going to use with general documentation and we end up with only short description of the specific term as page content. Then we realized that we can also add Additional Links related to this Term or to add some Analysis and Tutorials as additional page content, Pros. and Cons. etc… and we came up with idea of Wiki like dynamic layout following defined hierarchy for Headlines (Table of Context is in the second column for Headlines auto recognition to have quick page context overview with in-page links).

Also with Development space, we have for example Third Party Tools we are inserting as single documents. Then in our workflow we make Analysis and evaluation with Pros. and Cons. and then add selected ones with our development tools pages. To avoid duplicates we started updating same document (instead of creating a new one) using Headlines inside document to insert Analysis with Pros./Cons., source Links and maybe Tutorials if one or more exists etc. Then we plan to use Label to "tag" document as development-tool so we can list all documents with Label on dedicated page by using Content by label macro.

For Organization (Team members) space we need to add additional information with every profile (Profile data, Title, Skills, Location) so we are planning to use Page Properties macro to expand page attributes and we kindly ask you about your opinion for this approach? 
From your experience is this the right way to organize Team/Staff profile informations and how can we use those attributes as filters (for example skills, so we can easily find profiles with that criteria?)

As you can see from the intro description for the OT and our workflow we start with an idea description and envolve by inserting additional information to the same page (maybe there is a better approach?) and that's why we also end up with the ONE dynamic template idea.

Besides Meeting template and Decision logs almost all or documents has the same workflow and we are seeking for help/advice and your recommendation about how to create this OT the best possible way? 

We look forward to hear from you. Thank you very much in advance.
fields.summary: Ability to Create A Dynamic Template to Use For All Documentation in Confluence

fields.description:

No {{user_created}} Webhook event is received from apps.

*Steps to replicate*

 # Install app in Confluence cloud
 # Add new user by going to Settings -> Users

 # Contrary to when user is deactivated, a {{user_deactivated}} is received

 
h3. Additional Webhooks that don't work and needs investigation

group_created
group_removed
user_created
user_removed

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition  

* When a user is invited to a new Confluence instance, the following screen is shown when the user accesses the instance for the first time:

 !Screen Shot 2018-08-24 at 18.18.41.png|thumbnail! 

* This profile picture is actually never used since the user's avatar comes directly from the Atlassian Account.

h3. Suggested Solution  

* Remove this screen from Confluence's onboarding access.

h3. Why this is important   

* This profile picture is never used in Confluence and it creates a database entry in the _content_ table which never changes.
fields.summary: Adding a profile picture in Confluence doesn't save the picture in the instance

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Backups are failing to generate the zip file.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Start a site backup.

h3. Expected Results
* The backup zip file is provided.

h3. Actual Results
* The backup fails.
{quote}
Export error

Internal error: Unable to create zip file
But don't worry, we'll fix it for you!
You just need to contact Atlassian support and paste in this error message, timestamp and your instance details.
{quote}

{code}
java.lang.RuntimeException: Idle for too long
com.atlassian.ondemand.backupmanager.longrunning.SiteExportTaskRunner.handleZipperProgressEvent(SiteExportTaskRunner.java:273)
{code}

h3. Workaround
* Perform [Space imports|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/export-content-to-word-pdf-html-and-xml-724764824.html] if you need to back up your data.
fields.summary: Backups are failing to create zip file

fields.description:
Currently {{AP.confluence.getMacroData()}} is only available in macro edit mode. This request is to also make it available in macro view mode as well. Implementing this will:
 * Simplify the API
 * Enable macros to take advantage of cacheable app iframes ([https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/cacheable-app-iframes/).|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/cacheable-app-iframes/]
fields.summary: Make AP.confluence.getMacroData() available in view mode

fields.description:
h3. Overview
Recently Updated Macro Displays Profile Picture in Social theme when Show User Profile Pictures is deselected/unticked.

h3. Initial analysis
It seems that when selecting the 'Social' theme, the user profile picture is displayed regardless whether the option to 'Show User Profile Pictures' is selected or not. It seems that the 'Social' theme selection overrides the 'Show User Profile Pictures' selection in all cases.

h3. Steps to Replicate
# Add a 'Recently Updated macro' to a page.
# Select 'Social' as the theme of choice.
# keep 'Show User Profile Pictures' deselected.

h3. Expected Result
The macro should list recent updates using the social theme without the profile pictures.

h3. Actual Result
The 'Social' theme does not respect the selection state of the 'Show User Profile Pictures' box, and displays the profile picture regardless of the selection.

h3. Extra thoughts
If the 'Social' theme must display a profile picture, then the option to show/not to show the profile picture could be grayed out.

h3. Workaround
N/A
fields.summary: Recently Updated Macro Displays Profile Picture in Social theme when Show User Profile Pictures is deselected

fields.description:
h3. Summary  

* Recently added avatars using the *Profile Picture* macro are being displayed very blurry.

h3. Environment 
* Resolution over 1920x1080

h3. Steps to Reproduce 
# On a Confluence page, insert the *Profile Picture* macro;
# Publish the page

h3. Expected Results  
* The image is well rendered, without any blur.

h3. Actual Results 
* The picture is displayed very blurry on the published page, even though the image has high quality.
* Original picture:

 !default.jpg|thumbnail! 

* After using the *Profile Picture* macro

 !Screen Shot 2018-08-23 at 10.53.02.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround 
* Using the *Insert files and images* option won't blur the images.
fields.summary: Profile Picture macro displaying blurry avatars

fields.description: Currently, a Confluence page serves as a "folder" or "container" for all the files that is uploaded to a single attachment macro on a page. Hence, when a file is uploaded or move to a page, the file will exist in all the attachment macro if a page containing more than 1 attachment macro. It would be useful if a page is allowed to have multiple attachment macro to store different attachments.
fields.summary: Ability to choose for targeting attachment macro on the same page while moving attachment

fields.description:
h3. The Issue
Currently, when clicking on the *lock* icon from a restricted Page in Confluence Cloud, if the user is an administrator, his/her username is displayed on the list as if they had access to this page. When in fact, they don't. 

h3. Expected Behavior
- Either display a placeholder ie "Restrictions applied because you're an admin"
- or, hide the user when no restrictions apply to him/her

h3. Actual Behavior
The modal inserts the user as if they had View/Edit restrictions to the page
fields.summary: Hide administrator from Page Restrictions if the user is not on the list

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition  

* Sometimes you may want to restrict part of the content in a page from a set of users, while other groups can view this part of the content.

h3. Suggested Solution  

* Have the ability to select the excerpts of a content in a page to restrict from a group only.

h3. Why this is important   

* While writing a documentation, there might be some excerpts of it that need to be restricted to a few users only, within the context of that document.

h3. Workaround 

* Currently, the only way of restricting it would be to put the restricted content in a different page and applying Confluence's current [page's restrictions|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/add-or-remove-page-restrictions-724764891.html].
fields.summary: Ability to restrict content within a Confluence page

fields.description:
Customers reported that it would be useful if an advisory text when importing a Word using 'Import Word Document' file regarding the optimum size recommended to avoid failure of import due to the bug [Unable to Import large Word Document to Confluence|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-53372].

Customer have reported that the amount of time spent trying to optimize and clean up Word files could be saved if this info is displayed beforehand.
fields.summary: Add File Size Advisory Text To Import Word Document Screen

fields.description:
Currently, when you get mentioned in a page, Confluence sends an email notification that shows the name of the page you were mentioned on and an excerpt of the content from that page. No where in the email does it include the Space name. 

 

When the page title is vague (for example, "2018-08-21 Internal Weekly Status Notes") there's no way to know which Space the page is in reference to.
fields.summary: Include the Space name in emails
Freeze Prod to dogfood comment refactor

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Link function is broken if link is a long string (40+ characters) and has multiple ampersands characters

h3. Description
When using the Link function to add an external/web link, if you add an invalid link that contains multiple & (ampersand) characters, the page/tab will freeze.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# In a Confluence page, select some text and click the *Link* button
# Select the *Web Link* option
# Paste a long link -- such as {{AAAAAAAAAA.com/&AAAAAAAAAA&AAAAAAAAAA&AAAAAAAAAA&AAAAAAAAAA&AAAAAAAAAA}}

h3. Expected Results

You will be able to save the link and publish the page.

h3. Actual Results

The page/tab freezes and stops responding.

h3. Notes

* This might affect customers trying to use a Create Page from Template link , as the link requires multiple ampersands and is a long string of characters.
* Happens consistently in Google Chrome.
fields.summary: Link function is broken if link has multiple ampersands characters

fields.description:
h3. Summary  

* When drag and drop the files on *Browse for files* option in the Attachments macro, the macro will keep loading and does not show any progress bar indicating that the upload has been succeeded. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce 
# Create an Attachment macro on the page
# Drag and drop the file on the attachment box *Browse for files*
  !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
# Noticed that the macro does not show a progress as expected

h3. Expected Results 
* The progress bar will show the file has been uploaded.

h3. Actual Results 
* The macro keep spinning and doesn't show a progress bar for the upload.

h3.Workaround 
* Use the *drag & drop* option of the *Attachments* macro to see the progress bar.

 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Attach file using drag and drop on the attachment box do not show progress bar

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently mention doesn't work with {{@}} entered by [IME|https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Input_method].

 [^confluence-ime-mention.mov] 

h3. Suggested Solution

Make it able to pop up mention candidates with {{@}} entered by IME.
Jira works as expected.

 [^jira-ime-mention.mov] 

h3. Workaround

Enter {{@}} without IME.
fields.summary: Support mention with IME
Expose attachment comment status the same way as it works for inline comments

fields.description:
Currently, the only way for the administrators to check restricted pages is to access each spaces and check the Space Settings.
However, in the following situation, this operation requires a lot of work.
* There are many spaces in one site
* There is a possibility that a person who left the site had created restricted pages in several spaces

In this case, admins have to access all the spaces to check for potential restricted pages.

It'll be great if Confluence administrators are able to view all restricted pages and those creators across all the spaces in their site in one screen.
fields.summary: Allow Confluence administrators to check all restricted pages across all spaces

fields.description:
h3. Summary
 * When using the *Browse for files* option in the Attachments macro, the file won't be uploaded.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add the *Attachments* macro to a page;
 # On the *Attachments* macro of the published page, click on *Browse for files*;
 !Screen Shot 2018-08-20 at 16.07.55.png|thumbnail!
 # Select the file you wish to upload and confirm;

h3. Expected Results
 * The file will be uploaded correctly on the macro;

h3. Actual Results
 * The page acts like it uploaded the attachment but, when it refreshes, there is no attachment in there.

h3. Workaround
 * Use the *drag & drop* option of the *Attachments* macro (Depending on the case, it might not work)


Please also check the related issue and fix as part of looking into this issue.
fields.summary: Browse for files in the Attachments macro is not uploading files

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Copying and paste charts from another source are displaying as *!Broken Image*
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Copy a chart from an external source like Microsoft Excel or Google Sheets using the right-click menu from the mouse or using the keyboard shortcut;
* Paste it on a Confluence page;
* Publish the page.

h3. Expected Results
* The chart image displays.

h3. Actual Results
* A *!Broken Image* icon displays where the chart should be.

h3. Workaround
* Save the chart image to your machine and upload it using one of the options described on the [Upload files documentations|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/upload-files-724765101.html]
fields.summary: Copying and paste charts from another source breaks the image

fields.description:
* Ability to restrict who can add/edit the event types instead of just a blanket view or edit: We have our meeting rooms set up as team calendars and the type of meeting set up as various event types, currently I am unable to restrict who can add/edit the event types without restricting the ability to edit/add events in the calendar entirely. Given anyone can book these meeting rooms this is not useful.

 
 * Dont send notifications to attendees every time another attendee is added to the meeting.

 
 * Ability for site admins to see entire list of calendars in the Confluence Team Calendar add on section, currently you really only have the same features as a normal user when trying to find a calendar that someone may have misspelt
fields.summary: Confluence Team Calendars: Additional features

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When a full site import was done on a new instance, the inline comment auto coverted to a page comment after migration.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a page with inline comment
# Create a backup from the instance
# Import the export file using full site import.
# After migration noticed that the inline comment converted to a page comment.

h3. Expected Results

Inline comment stick as a inline comment after migration

h3. Actual Results

Inline comment coverted to page comment

h3. Workaround

# Use space import for those spaces with inline comment
{quote} Tested on space import and it's working fine{quote}
fields.summary: Inline comment converted to page comment after Full Site migration

# After migration noticed that the inline comment converted to a page comment.

h3. Actual Results

Workaround

{quote} Tested on space import and it's working fine{quote}
fields.summary: Inline comment coverted to page comment after Full Site migration

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The search feature is showing an error message in Mozilla Firefox

h3. Environment
* Mozilla Firefox

h3. Steps to Reproduce
It happens when you quickly press 'enter' after typing the search before the suggested issues are loaded. But the issue won't be replicable if you let the issues to load.
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
No error message

h3. Actual Results
"System Error" error message is showing

h3.Workaround
Use a different browser, i.e Chrome or Safari
fields.summary: Error message on the search

fields.description: It would be useful if there is a better consistency to improve the search result ordering as the search order was arranged in random sequences for every 3-4 attempt of search.
fields.summary: Improve search result ordering on Confluence

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update: October 19, 2020|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3c78b5|titleBGColor=#3c78b5|bgColor=#e7f4fa}
Hi all,

This is [~nagarwal@atlassian.com] from the Confluence team. Thank you for your feedback and support on this issue.

I have some great news. The new Decision Report Macro has been built and is going through internal dogfooding. We will start shipping this in the next couple of weeks. I will leave an update on this ticket once the deployment is fully complete.

Regards,
 Niraj Agarwal
 Developer, Confluence
{panel}
h3. Problem Definition

The New Editing Experience has introduced a new version of Decisions, which are similar to Tasks.

In order to keep an overview of all decisions, a way to aggregate and collect decisions, based on certain criteria would be welcome.

Currently, there's no way to access all meeting note's decisions the same way it's possible to access the Tasks.
h3. Suggested Solution

Implement a place to aggregate meeting note's decisions.
h3. Workaround

Access individually each meeting notes.
fields.summary: Create a place to aggregate decisions

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce, on a site with both Confluence and Jira:
 # From a scrum board in Jira, complete a sprint
 # Click to create a Confluence retrospective from the popup that appears on the next screen
 # A tab opens with Confluence, and the create dialog appears with the blank page selected by default

Two problems:
 # The retrospective blueprint should have been selected by default
 # After publishing the page, it should be linked to the Jira sprint that was completed (there should be a "Jira links" button appearing on the Confluence page with a popup that links back to the Jira sprint, and a similar link to the page from Jira)
fields.summary: Creating a Confluence retrospective page from Jira is broken

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When viewing some picture from Meeting Notes using Internet Explorer, some of the images does not load on (blank) the page itself. 


h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a meeting notes
# Insert some pictures (jpg,png,jpeg)
# View the images from Internet Explorer

h3. Expected Results

The images should be display on Internet Explorer 

h3. Actual Results

A blank section is shown on Internet Explorer 

h3. Workaround

# Use Chrome or other browser as a workaround.

h3. Note

Please do note that this issue seems to be happening randomly as it doesn't affected every meetings notes, not from what I have Tested.
fields.summary: Images from Meeting notes does not load intermittently in Internet Explorer
Users without add/delete comment will still be able to add or delete his/her comment or other people comment
Freeze Prod to dogfood comment refactor

fields.description: When composing a blog post in Confluence Cloud, the anchor macro is not on the macro browser.
fields.summary: Anchor macro not available while composing Blog post

fields.description:
When adding  the JIRA calendar to a confluence space you may get the following error:

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 


Refreshing the page will eventually load the gadget.
fields.summary: JIRA calendar giving gadget error

fields.description:
*Summary*

Issuea with 'Page Properties report' after migration because the ancestors' field saves the pageid and not page name.

 

*Environment*

Confluence Cloud

 

*Steps to Reproduce*

 

1. Add a new Page Properties report on a page with the following details:
 * *Label**
 * *In Space**
 * *With ancestors**

!Screen Shot 2018-08-15 at 13.39.41.png|thumbnail!

2. Publish the page and the report is displayed as expected

3. Export the space and import it to a new site

4. Open the page in the new site and notice that the report is empty, because the ancestors field has the page id of the page and not the 

!Screen Shot 2018-08-15 at 13.48.08.png|thumbnail!

*Expected Results*

The ancestors' field should save after the import the page name and not the id, as the page id is changed all the time when moving a page.

 

*Actual Results*

The ancestors' field has the pageid as a input and since the id changed after importing the page, this is not valid anymore.  

 

*Workaround*
 # Check the page title associated with the id the initial site
 # Edit the 'Page Properties Report' Macro and change the value for With ancestor from the pageid to the page title.
 # Preview the macro and notice that will show the correct report
fields.summary: 'Page Properties report' ancestors field wrongly saves the pageid after migration

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

It is not explicitly documented how many characters are ensured to save/copy/browse per page.
 Hence, Confluence user doesn't have any clear clue whether he/she should separate the page to avoid unexpected error beforehand.
 For example, it fails to copy the page containing 500k characters due to 504 Gateway Timeout Error.
h3. Suggested Solution

Define the spec and apply the integration test against the spec for every release.
h3. Workaround

None. Do not try to create a too large page.
fields.summary: Clarify the max number of characters per page

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When using the print function CTL+P in the browser, the content from the second page resulted as a blank page when using FireFox.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a page with content that would be occupied 2 pages for an A4
# Use the print function within the browser from FireFox
# The second part of the page resulted as a blank page

h3. Expected Results

The content should be displayed as expected.

h3. Actual Results

Second page of the content resulted as a blank page in A4 size.

h3. Workaround

# Use the export to PDF built-in function to export the content and print the content from pdf viewer.
# Use Chrome or other browser as a workaround.
fields.summary: Printing from FireFox as PDF resulted a blank page on the second page

fields.description:
Page has multiple full width columns and one full width column with right side bar at top of page. After making edits to the page and clicking publish, some of the full width columns change to two even columns.

When going back into edit mode, those columns showing as two even columns in publish mode are showing as full width columns (like they should). From here, I go back to publish mode and still get the same error - some full width columns showing as two even columns.

Resolve for me was to revert to a page version that was showing correctly and adding in my edits that I needed. However, after creating a couple more page versions, the same above error happened.

h3. Workaround

Converting the page to the new editor experience solves the issue (if the page is compatible with the conversion). If you have any questions about it, please, reach out to [Atlassian Support|https://getsupport.atlassian.com].
fields.summary: Page layout changes from full width to two columns after hitting publish

fields.description:
h3. Summary  

* When accessing a Confluence page using Internet Explorer in Windows 2012 or 2013, the _edit_, _save for later_, _watch_, _share_ and _more options_ buttons are invisible, even though the user has access to the page.

h3. Environment 
(Optional - If Applicable) 
* Windows 2012/2013
* Internet Explorer version 11

h3. Steps to Reproduce 
# Access a Confluence page in the specified environment;
# Wait for it to load fully.

h3. Expected Results  

* The _edit_, _save for later_, _watch_, _share_ and _more options_ buttons will be loaded.

h3. Actual Results 

* The _edit_, _save for later_, _watch_, _share_ and _more options_ buttons are not loaded, as per the screenshots below:

 !Screen Shot 2018-08-14 at 10.57.10.png|thumbnail! 

 !Screen Shot 2018-08-14 at 10.57.21.png|thumbnail! 

* The following errors are displayed in the console:

 !Screen Shot 2018-08-14 at 10.58.29.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround 

* N/A
fields.summary: Edit, Save for Later, Watch, Share buttons are invisible in Internet Explorer

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When exporting a space to PDF, the PDF shows an error rendering a page properties report macro when it pulls in many pages with include excerpt macros.
{noformat}
Unable to render \{include} Already included page 'snippet.check.instructions', stopping.
{noformat}
Resultant [PDF|https://getsupport.atlassian.com/secure/attachment/2738917/Instant%2027001%20PDF%20for%20HOTflo.pdf]. See pages 138/139.
h3. How to Replicate

*Note:* Unable to reproduce on a test instance so far, but can reproduce on the customer instance on the linked ticket

What we could try to replicate:
 # create a page with content in an excerpt macro
 # create 130+ pages with page properties that has an include excerpt macro
 # create a page with a page properties report
 # export the space to PDF

h3. Cause

The root cause is likely to lie in DetailsSummaryBuilder in master-details plugin (aka Page Properties Report) as we are building in the report in 4 threads.
 However, the include macro [https://stash.atlassian.com/projects/CONFCLOUD/repos/confluence-advanced-macros-plugin/browse/src/main/java/com/atlassian/confluence/plugins/macros/advanced/PageIncludeMacro.java#166] checks circular reference from the work context where the 4 threads shares
fields.summary: Page properties report errors out when exporting space to PDF

fields.description:
Instructional text added to a blueprint/template page appear in the search result even though it is not visible on the page created using the template after publishing. This behavior seems intermittent. Related to suggestion ticket: [Search results show instructional text|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-33208].

Steps to replicate:
# Create a template/blueprint with 'Instructional text'.
 !1-create-template.png|thumbnail! 
# Create a page using the template above and replace the instructional text.
 !2-page-from-template-create.png|thumbnail! 
# Publish the page.
 !3-published-page-from-template.png|thumbnail! 
# Create another page with a 'Live Search' macro.
# Type a search term to search for the newly created page
# Go to more results
!4-live-search-view-more.png|thumbnail! 
# The Instructional text will be visible!
 !5-instructional-text-appear-search.png|thumbnail! 

Workaround
N/A. Issue seems intermittent.
fields.summary: Instructional Text Appear in Search Excerpt Text and Search Results

fields.description:
Hello,

I'd like to see the OpenSearch-Standard being fully implemented. Currently, the endpoint already seems to be there, allowing to add confluence as a search engine; however, the autocomplete feature is not yet supported. It would be nice if you could also provide an endpoint returning the list of autocompletion texts from the website itself as a simple JSON list and a link with the "{{application/x-suggestions+json}}" MIME-type URL in the OpenSearch definition, so that the browser will show space and page titles as autocompletion results.
fields.summary: Browser Search Bar Autocomplete with OpenSearch application/x-suggestions+json

fields.description:
*Summary* 

Jira status takes a while to appear in confluence page after we change the status in Jira side.

*Steps to replicate*
# Add Jira issue to a Confluence page
# Change the status of the issue is Jira
# Go back to confluence page 

*Observed Behaviour*

Status of the Jira is not updated in confluence page


*Expected Behaviour*

The Jira status changes should have reflected on the confluence page after a few seconds.
fields.summary: Jira status take a while to appear in confluence page

fields.description: As a Srum Master I would like to add comments / updates to action items (similar to the tickbox for done) so that I can do more effective action tracking using confluence. It would be great if this can be edited in the summary view (when the actions from child pages are displayed on the parent page)
fields.summary: Ability to add comment or update to action item
